intro: Doria canadensis, commonly known as the Canada doria, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils in forested areas. Doria canadensis is often found in moist, shady environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
